item.title: 爱迪生公司将在洛杉矶野火受损地区埋设线路
item.description: 爱迪生千亿国际娱乐的公用事业部门表示，计划埋设超过 150 英里（241 公里）的电线，耗资高达 9.25 亿美元，作为洛杉矶地区受 1 月份野火破坏的居民区大规模重建工作的一部分。【原文：Edison International’s utility said it plans to bury more than 150 miles (241 kilometers) of electrical lines at a cost of as much as $925 million as part of a massive rebuilding effort in Los Angeles-area neighborhoods devastated by January wildfires.】

item.title: 前谷歌首席执行官称加拿大可满足人工智能竞赛的能源需求
item.description: 谷歌前首席执行官埃里克-施密特（Eric Schmidt）表示，如果加拿大能够在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战中与美国合作，那么加拿大丰富的水电资源将为蓬勃发展的人工智能服务器提供最佳动力，并在全球人工智能竞赛中获胜。【原文：Canada’s abundant hydroelectricity offers the best way to power booming artificial intelligence servers and win the global AI race — if the country is able to cooperate with the US amid a trade war with President Donald Trump, according to former Google chief Eric Schmidt.】

item.title: 基斯通输油管道污泥延误了评估损失所需的工作
item.description: 据北达科他州环境质量部称，由于工作人员必须清理现场周围的淤泥，Keystone 管道石油泄漏事故的挖掘工作已被推迟。【原文：Excavation work at a Keystone Pipeline oil spill has been delayed because crews must clean up sludge around the site, according to the North Dakota Department of Environmental Quality.】

item.title: 马斯克的收购计划将冲击美国 4000 亿美元的绿色能源银行
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，在埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）缩减联邦政府规模的努力中，能源部价值 4000 亿美元的绿色银行和清洁能源资助办公室将成为第二轮员工自愿离职的重灾区。【原文：The Energy Department’s $400 billion green bank and clean energy funding office are set to be among the hardest hit in a second round of voluntary employee buyouts as part of Elon Musk’s effort to cull the size of the federal government, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国石油公司投资者 L&G 将投票反对即将离任的董事会主席留任
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）最大的股东之一计划投票反对即将离任的董事长海尔格-伦德（Helge Lund）连任董事会成员，这凸显了该股东反对这家石油巨头偏离其净零战略。【原文：One of BP Plc’s largest shareholders plans to vote against the reelection of outgoing Chairman Helge Lund to the board, underscoring its opposition to the oil giant’s pivot away from its net zero strategy.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚首都在经历长达一年的危机后停止配给供水
item.description: 哥伦比亚首都波哥大的最高官员表示，随着雨季的到来，水库在经过一整年的限制后得以恢复，波哥大将停止配给供水。【原文：Bogotá will cease rationing water as the return on of the rainy season allows reservoirs to recover after a full year of restrictions, the Colombian capital’s top official said.】

item.title: 受特朗普抨击的 Paul Weiss 悄然从网站上删除 ESG 内容
item.description:
这家与总统达成协议的精英律师事务所的 ESG 咨询业务和研究所的网页现在已经变黑。【原文：

Web pages for the ESG advisory practice and institute at the elite law firm, which agreed to a deal with the president, are now dark. 

】

item.title: 全球航运监管机构批准具有里程碑意义的气候法规
item.description: 航运业的国际监管机构就削减该行业未来温室气体排放量的新规则达成一致，为未来几十年石油不再作为海运燃料铺平了道路。【原文：Shipping’s international regulator agreed new rules to slash the industry’s future greenhouse gas emissions, paving the way for the end of oil as a maritime fuel in the decades to come.】

item.title: 加州可以抵御特朗普的气候攻击。城市可能做不到
item.description:
一项行政命令针对各州的气候倡议，特别提到了加利福尼亚州、纽约州和佛蒙特州。【原文：

An executive order takes aim at state climate initiatives, singling out California, New York and Vermont.

】

item.title: Polestar 关闭中国门店，退出电动汽车销售合资企业
item.description: 电动汽车品牌Polestar正在缩减其在中国的业务，缩小其门店网络，并退出与一家本地公司的销售和营销合资企业。【原文：Electric vehicle brand Polestar is scaling back its presence in China, running down its store network and exiting a sales and marketing joint venture with a local company.】

item.title: 为什么房主选择热电池而不是热泵
item.description:
那些希望以绿色方式替代锅炉的人通常会考虑热泵—；但热电池是另一种无碳选择，也能储存能量。【原文：

Those wanting a green replacement for boilers often consider heat pumps — but heat batteries are another carbon-free option that also store energy.

】

item.title: 西班牙关闭核电站将检验可再生能源的成功案例
item.description:
即使在其他国家推迟关闭核电站并计划建造更多核电站的情况下，到2035年关闭所有核电站的计划仍保持不变。【原文：

Plans to shut down all nuclear power plants by 2035 remain unchanged even as other countries delay closures and plan to build more.

】

item.title: 特斯拉中国取消两款进口电动汽车的 "立即订购 "选项
item.description: 就在中国对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）加征关税进行报复的几天前，特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Tesla Inc.’s website in China has removed the ‘order now’ option for Model S and Model X electric vehicles, which are both imported, just days after China retaliated against US President Donald Trump’s tariffs by raising levies of its own.】

item.title: 环保署将缩减排放报告计划，ProPublica 称
item.description: 据 ProPublica 报道，美国环境保护局计划缩减强制主要污染企业（包括发电厂和工业设施）收集和报告温室气体排放数据的标准。【原文：The US Environmental Protection Agency plans to scale back standards that compel major polluters — including power plants and industrial facilities — to collect and report data on greenhouse gas emissions, ProPublica reported.】

item.title: 四位参议院共和党人誓言捍卫气候法税收减免政策
item.description: 四位共和党参议员警告说，不要全面废除前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）签名的气候法中的能源税收抵免措施，他们要求党内领导层采取有节制的做法。【原文：Four Republican senators are warning against a wholesale repeal of energy tax credits in former President Joe Biden’s signature climate law, asking their party’s leadership to instead take a measured approach.】

item.title: 风险气候武器的时代可能已经到来
item.description:
在彭博社原创系列报道 Primer的这一集中，我们访问了使用地球工程技术为全球变暖寻找银弹的初创公司。【原文：

On this episode of the Bloomberg Originals series Primer, we visit the startups using geoengineering to find a silver bullet for global warming.

】

item.title: 拉尼娜现象结束有可能引发活跃的大西洋飓风季节
item.description: 扰乱天气的拉尼娜天气模式已经结束，赤道太平洋气温恢复到中性状态，这可能预示着大西洋飓风季节的活跃。【原文：The weather-roiling La Niña weather pattern has ended, returning equatorial Pacific temperatures to a neutral state that could portend an active Atlantic hurricane season.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税和命令如何影响气候技术投资
item.description: 过去六个月，美国气候技术行业受到了极大的冲击，但该行业的风险投资却在不断增加。【原文：The last six months have given the US climate tech sector an extreme case of whiplash, yet venture funding to the industry is on the rise.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州是美国电池业蓬勃发展的原点
item.description: "钻井，宝贝，钻井 "可能是得克萨斯州的非官方座右铭，但 "商店，宝贝，商店 "正变得越来越准确。【原文：“Drill, baby, drill” may be Texas’s unofficial motto, but “store, baby, store” is becoming more accurate.】

item.title: 金融体系如何为气候工作，而不是与气候作对
item.description:
"发展中国家说，我们需要的数字是1万亿美元，发达国家说，'这不是我们的预算'，"美洲开发银行的阿维纳什-佩尔绍德（Avinash Persaud）在本周的Zero 节目中说道。【原文：

“Developing countries have said the number we need is $1 trillion. Developed countries have said, ‘That’s not coming from our budgets,’” says Avinash Persaud of Inter-American Development Bank on this week’s Zero episode.

】

item.title: 国际能源机构称，人工智能数据中心的增长意味着更多煤炭和天然气发电厂的出现
item.description: 根据国际能源机构的一份新报告，以人工智能为重点的数据中心的增长将推动对燃气和燃煤发电厂的需求。【原文：Growth in artificial intelligence-focused data centers will drive demand for gas- and coal-fired power plants, according to a new report from the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: 绿色和平组织称，2024 年人工智能芯片制造排放将增加四倍
item.description: 根据绿色和平组织对公司和公开数据的分析，作为人工智能服务基础的半导体生产所产生的排放量在 2024 年增长了四倍多。【原文：Emissions generated from the production of semiconductors that underpin AI services grew more than fourfold in 2024, according to a Greenpeace analysis of company and publicly available data.】

item.title: 花旗计划针对发展中市场建立债务转换管道
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）的目标是建立一个交易管道，使新兴市场的主权发行人能够对其债务进行再融资，并将节省下来的资金用于实现比以往此类交易更广泛的目标。【原文：Citigroup Inc. aims to build a pipeline of deals that would allow sovereign issuers in emerging markets to refinance their debt and put savings toward a wider array of goals than such deals have previously encompassed.】

item.title: 特朗普将矛头指向他抱怨已久的 "软弱 "淋浴喷头
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统签署了一项行政命令，旨在放宽限制淋浴喷头水流量的规定，针对的是他长期以来一直抱怨的使他难以正常洗头的问题。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive order aimed at relaxing rules that limit water flow for shower heads, targeting an issue he has long complained makes it harder for him to properly wash his hair.】

item.title: 耗资 200 亿美元的天然气厂暴露了澳大利亚的能源难题
item.description: 就在上个月举行联邦大选的四天前，澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞的政府悄悄地推迟了一项将决定该国未来几十年能源发展道路的决定。【原文：Just four days before he called a federal election last month, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s government quietly pushed back a decision that will set the country’s energy path for decades to come.】

item.title: 特朗普豁免最脏煤电厂遵守污染规定
item.description: 作为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普振兴燃煤发电行业努力的一部分，美国最脏的燃煤发电厂和其他几十家燃煤发电厂正被豁免于严格的空气污染规定。【原文：The dirtiest coal-fired power plant in the US and dozens of others are being exempted from stringent air pollution mandates as part of US President Donald Trump’s bid to revitalize the industry.】

item.title: 特朗普签署命令保护大石油公司免受州排放罚款
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正命令司法部对那些因温室气体排放而对化石燃料公司处以罚款的州采取法律行动。【原文：US President Donald Trump is ordering the Justice Department to take legal action against states that impose fines on fossil fuel companies for their greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 黑格塞斯称美国寻求结束中国对巴拿马运河的影响
item.description: 美国国防部长皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth）周三在巴拿马城表示，美国决心消除中国对巴拿马运河的 "恶意影响"，以此作为 "让美洲再次伟大 "努力的一部分。【原文：The US is determined to eliminate China’s “malign influence” over the Panama Canal as part of the effort to “make the Americas great again,” Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Wednesday in Panama City.】

item.title: 墨西哥 5 月招标 31 亿美元新电力项目
item.description: 墨西哥正在向私营部门求助，以建设大量新的发电和输电项目，并加强饱受停电和投资不足困扰的电网。【原文：Mexico is turning to the private sector as it seeks to build extensive new electricity generation and transmission projects and shore up a struggling power grid that’s been plagued by blackouts and underinvestment.】

item.title: 巴菲特的金霸王公司因锂离子电池机密被巴斯夫起诉
item.description: 亿万富翁投资者沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）旗下的金霸王电池制造商被化学品生产商巴斯夫公司（BASF SE）指控窃取锂离子电池技术的商业机密。【原文：Billionaire investor Warren Buffett’s Duracell battery maker was accused by chemical producer BASF SE of stealing trade secrets about lithium ion battery technology.】
